newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela CANTV workers threaten indefinite strike.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela CANTV workers threaten indefinite strike.

text.p: Workers at national Venezuelan telephone company CANTV have threatened to go on an indefinite strike, Cruz Hernandez, president of the umbrella labor group for telecommunications workers Fetratel, told Reuters.
The workers will set a strike date next Thursday if CANTV does not improve before then on recent wage offers.
The company proposed a 40 percent increase in pay bonuses Wednesday, Hernandez said, "which was immediately refused".
That proposal was the third to be rejected by workers. It followed a February 5 offer that CANTV said upped take-home pay 37 percent in 1996 and 77 percent next year.
Workers have said they want a 125 percent increase to compensate for triple-digit inflation last year.
